es.csic.iiia.nsm.perception

Class ViewTransition

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.csic.iiia.nsm.perception.ViewTransition

  • public class ViewTransition
extends java.lang.Object
    A view transition describes the evolution of a part of the system scenario along a period of time. It consists in a list of views (View), where each view corresponds to a given time step. As an example, a view transition composed of three views contains information about the evolution of a part of the scenario during three consecutive time steps
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"

    • Method Detail

      • getView

        public View getView(int timestep)
        Returns the View that corresponds to a particular timestep
        Parameters:
        timestep - the time step of the view to get
        Returns:
        the view that corresponds to the given time step

      • setView

        public void setView(int timestep,
                    View view)
        Sets a view for a particular time step. The value 0 is the final time step. Previous steps are n (t-n), n+1, (t-n+1) and so on until t
        Parameters:
        timestep - - the time step
        view - - the view that corresponds to the given time step
